pattern_attributes.description: Design has features to support disability or medical needs
pattern_attributes.name: adaptive design

pattern_attributes.description: Design provides for access to/from a medical device
pattern_attributes.name: medical device access

pattern_attributes.description: Design is an accessory for a medical device
pattern_attributes.name: medical device support

pattern_attributes.description: Design is an accessory for a mobility aid
pattern_attributes.name: mobility aid support

pattern_attributes.description: Therapy aids and toys
pattern_attributes.name: therapy aid/toy

pattern_attributes.description: 18 years or over
pattern_attributes.name: adult

pattern_attributes.description: birth to 12  months
pattern_attributes.name: baby

pattern_attributes.description: 4 to 12 years
pattern_attributes.name: child (4-12)

pattern_attributes.description: scaled for a toy figure
pattern_attributes.name: doll

pattern_attributes.description: to fit a newborn baby
pattern_attributes.name: newborn

pattern_attributes.description: to fit a premature baby
pattern_attributes.name: preemie

pattern_attributes.description: 13 to 17 years
pattern_attributes.name: teen (13-17)

pattern_attributes.description: 1 to 3 years
pattern_attributes.name: toddler (1-3)

pattern_attributes.description: measurements of garment are  smaller than the corresponding body measurements, creating a snugger  fit
pattern_attributes.name: negative ease

pattern_attributes.description: measurements of  the garment are the same as corresponding body measurments
pattern_attributes.name: no ease

pattern_attributes.description: measurements of the garment are  larger than corresponding body measurements
pattern_attributes.name: positive ease

pattern_attributes.description: fits close to the body
pattern_attributes.name: fitted

pattern_attributes.description: extra length and extra width/room is added to the waist to  accomodate a pregnant woman's stomach
pattern_attributes.name: maternity fit

pattern_attributes.description: designed to fit small-scale items
pattern_attributes.name: miniature

pattern_attributes.description: large amount of positive ease used as a design element.
pattern_attributes.name: oversized fit

pattern_attributes.description: contains instructions for size XS and smaller
pattern_attributes.name: petite fit

pattern_attributes.description: contains instructions for size XL and larger
pattern_attributes.name: plus fit

pattern_attributes.description: contains instructions for taller individuals
pattern_attributes.name: tall fit

pattern_attributes.description: Usually used or worn by females
pattern_attributes.name: female

pattern_attributes.description: Usually used or worn by males
pattern_attributes.name: male

pattern_attributes.description: Used or worn by anyone
pattern_attributes.name: unisex

pattern_attributes.description: a two-color ribbing in which the knits are worked in one color and the purls in a second color.
pattern_attributes.name: corrugated ribbing

pattern_attributes.description: a knitting and crochet technique that produces an hidden image that is only viewable from an angle.
pattern_attributes.name: illusion/shadow

pattern_attributes.description: colorwork technique used to create separate blocks of color and in which each area of color has its own separate length of yarn.
pattern_attributes.name: Intarsia

pattern_attributes.description: colorwork technique in which the color pattern is made by slipping stitches, with only one color is worked on each row.
pattern_attributes.name: mosaic

pattern_attributes.description: multi-color knitting with all yarn used in the row/round carried across the back of the work.
pattern_attributes.name: stranded

pattern_attributes.description: Alternating sections of two or more colors
pattern_attributes.name: stripes / colorwork

pattern_attributes.description: worked on the diagonal.
pattern_attributes.name: bias

pattern_attributes.description: worked from the bottom of the garment/accessory toward the top.
pattern_attributes.name: bottom up

pattern_attributes.description: a small hole or slit in a garment or piece of fabric used for fastening a button.
pattern_attributes.name: buttonholes

pattern_attributes.description: a knitting technique in which one works with two yarns simultaneously to create two separate pieces of fabric that may be joined at the sides and bottom or remain unconnected.
pattern_attributes.name: double knitting

pattern_attributes.description: a knitting and crochet technique used to create a textured diamond or basketwork pattern.
pattern_attributes.name: entrelac

pattern_attributes.description: a finishing process in which the animal fiber fabric is subjected to moisture, heat, and friction so that the fibers cling together, thus shrinking considerably to make a denser and thicker fabric.
pattern_attributes.name: felted/fulled

pattern_attributes.description: crochet or knitting worked in seemingly random shapes, colors, and techniques.
pattern_attributes.name: freeform

pattern_attributes.description: an insertion of an extra shape of fabric separate from the main body of knitting, typically in the shape of a triangle or diamond, used to increase strength or aid in movement.
pattern_attributes.name: gusset

pattern_attributes.description: a narrow tube of knitting worked in the round that is often used for the handles of a bag, cords to tie on a hat, to edge a garment, or for a decorative effect.
pattern_attributes.name: icord

pattern_attributes.description: a method of connecting the live stitches of two pieces of knitting by following loops of knit or purl stitches, resulting in a seamless look.
pattern_attributes.name: kitchener/grafting

pattern_attributes.description: a technique in which small pieces of fabric are joined together as they are worked to make a larger item.
pattern_attributes.name: modular / join as you go

pattern_attributes.description: A twisted shape with only one side worked by using a moebius cast-on with a circular needle or twisted cast-on in crochet and working outward, or by joining the ends of a flat piece with a 1/2 twist.
pattern_attributes.name: moebius

pattern_attributes.description: components or elements that are worked separately and either joined as they are worked or seamed together after completion. Does not apply to colorwork design motifs.
pattern_attributes.name: motifs

pattern_attributes.description: worked in one piece, either seamlessly or with seams.
pattern_attributes.name: one-piece

pattern_attributes.description: A cast-on worked with waste yarn that is later removed so the cast-on stitches can be picked up and knit in the opposite direction.
pattern_attributes.name: provisional cast-on

pattern_attributes.description: worked as individual pieces, joined together with a seam.
pattern_attributes.name: seamed

pattern_attributes.description: not joined by or having seams
pattern_attributes.name: seamless

pattern_attributes.description: edge stitches, usually only one or two stitches distinct from the body of the garment (such as a slipped stitch or a single garter stitch at the end/beginning of each row).
pattern_attributes.name: selvedge

pattern_attributes.description: A technique where partial rows are worked back and forth, adding a curve, bulge, or shaping to an otherwise flat piece.
pattern_attributes.name: short rows

pattern_attributes.description: Worked from side to side rather than top down or bottom up.
pattern_attributes.name: sideways

pattern_attributes.description: A vertical column of knitted stitches intended to be cut apart  during the finishing of the item.
pattern_attributes.name: steeks

pattern_attributes.description: A method of joining two pieces together in knitting in which the live stitches from two pieces are knit together and cast off with a third needle.
pattern_attributes.name: three needle bind off

pattern_attributes.description: Short pieces of roving or other thick material used to add thickness and insulation. Ususally creates a decorative V-shaped pattern on the public side of the piece.
pattern_attributes.name: thrums

pattern_attributes.description: worked from the top of the garment/accessory toward the bottom.
pattern_attributes.name: top down

pattern_attributes.description: A technique, originating in Sweden, that uses two strands of yarn (usually two ends of the same ball of yarn) which are twined between stitches.  Also called two-end knitting, or Tvåändsstickning
pattern_attributes.name: twined knitting

pattern_attributes.description: worked back-and-forth in rows.
pattern_attributes.name: worked flat

pattern_attributes.description: Worked in a continuous around and around fashion. Can be flat (like a circular shawl started from the center) or tubular (like a sock or sleeve).
pattern_attributes.name: worked in the round

pattern_attributes.description: a technique that utilizes a large dowel, broomstick, or knitting needle to create large loops that are incorporated into a lacy fabric.
pattern_attributes.name: broomstick crochet

pattern_attributes.description: a technique imitating bobbin-made braid/tape laces.
pattern_attributes.name: bruges crochet

pattern_attributes.description: a technique that creates a wrapped look or "bullion" around the stitch.
pattern_attributes.name: bullion / roll stitch

pattern_attributes.description: a small knot made by making a chain, alternately wrapping the thread around the hook and chain, then drawing a loop through all loops on hook. A slip stitch is worked over the base of knot to close.
pattern_attributes.name: clones knot

pattern_attributes.description: a variation of tunisian crochet that uses a double ended hook to create a double sided fabric.
pattern_attributes.name: cro-hook / croknit

pattern_attributes.description: a cross between needle tatting and crochet, made with straight hooks like those used in bullion crochet.
pattern_attributes.name: cro-tatting / crochet

pattern_attributes.description: a grid-like type of crocheted lace fabric which uses only two crochet stitches: the chain stitch and the double crochet stitch (or treble).
pattern_attributes.name: filet crochet

pattern_attributes.description: a stitch which is worked around the "post" of the stitch in the previous row, instead of into the top of the stitch like in a "normal" crochet stitch.
pattern_attributes.name: front/back post stitch

pattern_attributes.description: crochet square motifs (many possible variations).
pattern_attributes.name: granny square

pattern_attributes.description: a textile-making technique in which a lacy fabric is made by forming open, looped stitches with a crochet hook and a hairpin lace loom, a small handheld tool having two parallel metal prongs around which the loops are formed.
pattern_attributes.name: hairpin crochet

pattern_attributes.description: a technique characterized by separately crocheted motifs later assembled into a mesh background, which usually employs several sizes of thread. Padded crochet, multiple thicknesses of thread (the thickest is used for the padding cord), and joining-while-b
pattern_attributes.name: Irish crochet

pattern_attributes.description: a crochet technique in which a single crochet is worked into an elongated loop. Creates a mesh-like, open fabric.
pattern_attributes.name: lover's knot/Solomon's knot/knot stitch

pattern_attributes.description: a common traditional lacy motif resembling a pineapple in shape which can be worked alone or joined, or used as a design element in a crocheted lace item.
pattern_attributes.name: pineapple crochet

pattern_attributes.description: A technique using only slip stitches to create fabric. Usually thinner and stretchier than other crochet fabric, sometimes has the appearance of knitted fabric. Also referred to as pjoning, Bosnian crochet and shepherd’s knitting.
pattern_attributes.name: slip stitch crochet

pattern_attributes.description: a method in which embellishments or designs are added by crocheting them onto/into the finished fabric.
pattern_attributes.name: surface crochet

pattern_attributes.description: a technique using multiple yarns, usually in different colors, that are carried across to create a motif; also referred to as mosaic, jacquard, intarsa, colorwork, fair-isle, or hard crochet.
pattern_attributes.name: tapestry crochet

pattern_attributes.description: typically worked on a long hook with a stopper on the end; creates a fabric that looks almost woven instead of either knitted or crocheted. Also referred to as Afghan Crochet or Afghan Stitch.
pattern_attributes.name: Tunisian / afghan crochet

pattern_attributes.description: An extra length of fabric that is attached to the neck opening of a garment.
pattern_attributes.name: collared

pattern_attributes.description: A short standing collar that is separated by a gap at the front and/or back.  Also called a Nehru collar.
pattern_attributes.name: mandarin

pattern_attributes.description: a small flat collar that is rounded at the front.
pattern_attributes.name: peter pan

pattern_attributes.description: a collar or edge treatment to for a neck that is closely rolled and and very short.
pattern_attributes.name: rolled

pattern_attributes.description: a wide, turned-over collar of a garment that combines with lapels forming an unbroken curving line.
pattern_attributes.name: shawl collar

pattern_attributes.description: short folded collar that opens in the middle and has pointed ends. Sometimes fastens with buttons.
pattern_attributes.name: shirt

pattern_attributes.description: an edge that is added to a piece using a crochet hook.
pattern_attributes.name: crocheted edging

pattern_attributes.description: An edge to that is added to fabric (applied either during the construction or after, during finishing) made of a narrow tube worked in stockinette.
pattern_attributes.name: icord edging

pattern_attributes.description: an edge of an item that includes open work in knitted or crocheted lace
pattern_attributes.name: lace edging

pattern_attributes.description: a high, wide scoop neck.
pattern_attributes.name: ballet neck

pattern_attributes.description: a neckline created when two rectangles are sewn together (sometimes overlapping) leaving an unshaped opening in the middle.
pattern_attributes.name: boat neck

pattern_attributes.description: a loose-fitting, draped, turned-over neckline.
pattern_attributes.name: cowl neck

pattern_attributes.description: a round neckline that is close to the neck.
pattern_attributes.name: crew neck

pattern_attributes.description: a neckline/collar that is worked as an extension of the body and usually extends a short distance.
pattern_attributes.name: funnel neck

pattern_attributes.description: a neckline with straps, bands, or ties that wrap around and connect at the nape of the neck.
pattern_attributes.name: halter

pattern_attributes.description: a neckline treatment with a placket (usually buttoned) and round neck, with a band or no collar.
pattern_attributes.name: henley

pattern_attributes.description: a neckline with a rounded opening which closes at the top.
pattern_attributes.name: keyhole neck

pattern_attributes.description: a tube neck, shorter than a turtleneck, generally with no foldover.
pattern_attributes.name: mock turtle

pattern_attributes.description: a low rounded neckline. aan be almost as short as a crew neck or very deep.
pattern_attributes.name: scoop neck

pattern_attributes.description: a neckline that has distinct corners in the front, with parallel side edges.
pattern_attributes.name: square neck

pattern_attributes.description: a cross over necklin which can be constructed as a wrap front garment or as a single front with one layer of the neckline under the other.
pattern_attributes.name: surplice

pattern_attributes.description: a rounded v-neck which creates a shape like a heart.
pattern_attributes.name: sweetheart neck

pattern_attributes.description: a tall rolled or folded collar, which is called turtleneck in the US, polo neck in the UK.
pattern_attributes.name: turtle neck

pattern_attributes.description: a neckline with straight sides that meet at a pointed bottom.
pattern_attributes.name: v neck

pattern_attributes.description: a pocket added after the garment is completed
pattern_attributes.name: afterthought pocket

pattern_attributes.description: has another type of pocket incorporated into the design not included in the list
pattern_attributes.name: any pockets

pattern_attributes.description: a pocket in the garment seam that isn't readily visible
pattern_attributes.name: hidden / inseam

pattern_attributes.description: a pocket made from a separate piece that's sewn on
pattern_attributes.name: patch

pattern_attributes.description: a pocket whose opening is knitted into the body of a garment
pattern_attributes.name: set-in

pattern_attributes.description: a sleeve that ends halfway between the wrist bone and the elbow.
pattern_attributes.name: 3/4 length

pattern_attributes.description: not sleeveless.
pattern_attributes.name: any sleeves

pattern_attributes.description: sleeve ends slightly above the wrist bone.
pattern_attributes.name: bracelet length

pattern_attributes.description: a very short sleeve style which covers the top of shoulder and usually has little or no length at the underarm.
pattern_attributes.name: cap

pattern_attributes.description: a technique where the shoulder seams and sleeve caps of a garment are worked from the top down.
pattern_attributes.name: contiguous

pattern_attributes.description: sleeve has a cuff, fold, or band that serves as the trim or finish to the bottom.
pattern_attributes.name: cuffed

pattern_attributes.description: a sleeve usually formed integrally with the front and back with a deep armhole starting low on the body; often shaped like a large triangle tapering at the wrist.
pattern_attributes.name: dolman

pattern_attributes.description: a shoulder seam that extends beyond the natural shoulder edge and usually creates a wider fitting sleeve.
pattern_attributes.name: drop

pattern_attributes.description: sleeve ends at the elbow
pattern_attributes.name: elbow

pattern_attributes.description: a short, loose sleeve that falls in folds over the upper arm.
pattern_attributes.name: flutter

pattern_attributes.description: sleeve ends at the wrist bone or later
pattern_attributes.name: long

pattern_attributes.description: a drop sleeve with minimal shaping at the armpit to reduce fabric bulk.
pattern_attributes.name: modified drop

pattern_attributes.description: diagonal armhole shaping running from the underarm to the middle of the sleeve. Reverse shaping to Raglan.
pattern_attributes.name: Nalgar (EZ notation)

pattern_attributes.description: sleeves with extra fullness at the shoulder, generally gathered or pleated at the top of the armhole seam and again in a band at the sleeve bottom.
pattern_attributes.name: puffed

pattern_attributes.description: diagonal armhole shaping, running from the underarm to the neckline.
pattern_attributes.name: raglan

pattern_attributes.description: a sleeve with a narrow strip that extends to the neckline which creates two shoulder seams rather than one.
pattern_attributes.name: saddle shoulder

pattern_attributes.description: armhole shaping like that on a 'traditional' dress or buttondown shirt.  A scooped shape at the underarm extending in a straight line up to the shoulder.
pattern_attributes.name: set in

pattern_attributes.description: a sleeve that ends above the elbow.
pattern_attributes.name: short

pattern_attributes.description: a garment that is without any sort of sleeve
pattern_attributes.name: sleeveless

pattern_attributes.description: a sleeve, usually short or cap, consisting of two layers that overlap at the outside of the arm like the shape of petals of a tulip.
pattern_attributes.name: tulip

pattern_attributes.description: a garment that is fitted around one point, most commonly the shoulders or the waist, and gradually widens out toward the hem giving the impression of a capital letter A.
pattern_attributes.name: A line

pattern_attributes.description: fabric has a smaller ornament or embellishment applied to its surface for decoration.
pattern_attributes.name: appliqued / embellished

pattern_attributes.description: designed to be unbalanced on ppposite sides of the finished object.
pattern_attributes.name: asymmetric

pattern_attributes.description: utilizes some type of closure at the back of a garment or piece.
pattern_attributes.name: back fastening

pattern_attributes.description: embellished with beads or pailettes.
pattern_attributes.name: beads / pailettes

pattern_attributes.description: a style of please that is actually two pleats facing opposite directions to make a flat surface between pleats; can be reversible.
pattern_attributes.name: box pleats

pattern_attributes.description: embellished or fastened with buttons or something button-like.
pattern_attributes.name: buttoned

pattern_attributes.description: a yoke with a rounded look which integrates shoulder and neck, with shaping spread evenly around circumference.
pattern_attributes.name: circular yoke

pattern_attributes.description: designed to be changed from one style to another.
pattern_attributes.name: convertible

pattern_attributes.description: shortened or clipped in length.
pattern_attributes.name: cropped

pattern_attributes.description: a decrease/increase along a line which creates shaping.
pattern_attributes.name: darts

pattern_attributes.description: fastened by overlapping one edge of the front over the other, usually with a double row of buttons.
pattern_attributes.name: double breasted

pattern_attributes.description: embellishment technique using a second yarn (often of a contrasting color) and tapestry needle to create a design on a piece of fabric by working over existing stitches.
pattern_attributes.name: duplicate stitch

pattern_attributes.description: surface embellishment worked on the finished piece using a thread/string/yarn and tapestry needle.
pattern_attributes.name: embroidery

pattern_attributes.description: waist shaping (seamed or not) that falls just under the bustline.
pattern_attributes.name: empire waist

pattern_attributes.description: pieces of material that are folded back & inside, usually at the edges of a garment but sometimes over a seam.
pattern_attributes.name: facings

pattern_attributes.description: Decorative edging consisting of lengths of yarn or fabric attached at one end to the work.
pattern_attributes.name: fringe

pattern_attributes.description: utilizes some type of closure at the front of a garment or piece.
pattern_attributes.name: front fastening

pattern_attributes.description: small fold or pucker made by gathering fabric together.
pattern_attributes.name: gathers

pattern_attributes.description: An edge finish that consists of a folded back edge that is then fastened down.
pattern_attributes.name: hems

pattern_attributes.description: A covering for the head and neck.
pattern_attributes.name: hood

pattern_attributes.description: has a material or fabric that covers all or part of the inner surface of the garment or item.
pattern_attributes.name: lined

pattern_attributes.description: has a v-shaped cut or indentation.
pattern_attributes.name: notched

pattern_attributes.description: a short flared, ruffled, or gathered, strip attached to the waistline of a garment to create a frill or flounce.
pattern_attributes.name: peplum

pattern_attributes.description: a series of small, ornamental looped shapes which form a decorate edge or embellishment to fabric.
pattern_attributes.name: picots

pattern_attributes.description: a back treatment for sleeveless garments which is formed by extra deep armholes or straps that meet at a narrow back.
pattern_attributes.name: racer back

pattern_attributes.description: fabric that is significantly wider at one edge than the opposite edge, resulting in a frilled or flounced appearance.
pattern_attributes.name: ruffles

pattern_attributes.description: having fastenings on the shoulders.
pattern_attributes.name: shoulder fastening

pattern_attributes.description: coat, jacket, cardigan or vest with a single row of buttons.  Front pieces usually only overlap for the width of the button band.
pattern_attributes.name: single breasted

pattern_attributes.description: enclosures or fasteners for a garment that are made up of two pieces that fit into one another and snap together to secure the two pieces of the garment.
pattern_attributes.name: snaps

pattern_attributes.description: without shaping
pattern_attributes.name: straight

pattern_attributes.description: Alternating sections of two or more colors or textures.
pattern_attributes.name: stripes

pattern_attributes.description: an exagerrated, loosely flared shape, usually on a coat or jacket.
pattern_attributes.name: swing

pattern_attributes.description: a dangling decorative trim or adornment consisting of a bunch of cords fastened at one end.
pattern_attributes.name: tassel / pompom

pattern_attributes.description: fastened with tied cords/strings.
pattern_attributes.name: tied

pattern_attributes.description: shaping in the waist area in order to give the garment a  defined waist.
pattern_attributes.name: waist shaping

pattern_attributes.description: garment that folds around the body.
pattern_attributes.name: wrap

pattern_attributes.description: item is fastened or embellished with a zipper.
pattern_attributes.name: zipper

pattern_attributes.description: a set of stitches forming a raised bump
pattern_attributes.name: bobble / popcorn / nupp

pattern_attributes.description: Fabric with tucked stitches (yarn overs that are knitted together with a slipped stitch from the previous row). Such stitches may also be made by knitting into the row below and dropping the stitch above.
pattern_attributes.name: brioche / tuck stitch

pattern_attributes.description: crossing one set of stitches over another
pattern_attributes.name: cables

pattern_attributes.description: A  stitch pattern that causes the fabric to make zigzags.
pattern_attributes.name: chevron / flame stitch

pattern_attributes.description: knit stitches that are dropped and allowed to unravel producing open, vertical stripes in the fabric
pattern_attributes.name: dropped stitches

pattern_attributes.description: fabric that easily returns to its original shape after being stretched
pattern_attributes.name: elastic

pattern_attributes.description: a fabric that incorporates yarn overs to create a hole used for  either aesthetic or funtional purposes
pattern_attributes.name: eyelets

pattern_attributes.description: a pattern of stable holes that are arranged to create a decorative fabric
pattern_attributes.name: lace

pattern_attributes.description: a simple, open fabric resembling netting
pattern_attributes.name: mesh

pattern_attributes.description: Both sides of  the fabric are attractive enough to be considered the "right" side
pattern_attributes.name: reversible

pattern_attributes.description: fabric creating a verticallyl ridged pattern
pattern_attributes.name: ribbed / ribbing

pattern_attributes.description: a horizontal undulating wave pattern.
pattern_attributes.name: ripple

pattern_attributes.description: in knitting, stitches moved from one needle to  the other without being worked; in crochet, stitiches used when a crochet stitch doesn't need added height
pattern_attributes.name: slipped stitches

pattern_attributes.description: fabric gathered at certain locations to bring in, or reduce width or height
pattern_attributes.name: smocked

pattern_attributes.description: A mix of stitches providing surface interest
pattern_attributes.name: textured

pattern_attributes.description: Stitches worked so the legs are  crossed
pattern_attributes.name: twisted stitches

pattern_attributes.description: pattern or pattern images are not appropriate for all ages
pattern_attributes.name: Mature Content

pattern_attributes.description: uses a visual  made of symbols and/or shapes to convey directions
pattern_attributes.name: chart

pattern_attributes.description: Instructions for machine knitting are provided in the pattern
pattern_attributes.name: has machine instructions

pattern_attributes.description: includes a drawing, probably with measurements
pattern_attributes.name: has schematic

pattern_attributes.description: pattern instructions are available in a format that is designed for low vision readers
pattern_attributes.name: low vision

pattern_attributes.description: uses photographs or drawings to show  the neccesary steps
pattern_attributes.name: photo tutorial

pattern_attributes.description: not a precise, step-by-step pattern
pattern_attributes.name: recipe - percentage / calculated

pattern_attributes.description: uses a video to show methods/steps used in creation
pattern_attributes.name: video tutorial

pattern_attributes.description: uses words to describe the techniques involved
pattern_attributes.name: written pattern

pattern_attributes.description: stuffed animals and anthropomorphic creatures made in a style of crochet and knitting originating in Japan.
pattern_attributes.name: amigurumi

pattern_attributes.description: using construction techniques and/or colorwork motifs derived from Peru and/or the Andean mountains of South America.
pattern_attributes.name: Andean / Peruvian

pattern_attributes.description: a style of work that includes intricate designs using cables, bobbles and other decorative elements that originated in the Aran Islands of Ireland.
pattern_attributes.name: Aran

pattern_attributes.description: A style of textured knitting employing twisted stitches, traveling stitches, and narrow cables.
pattern_attributes.name: Bavarian

pattern_attributes.description: colorwork sweaters, usually featuring distinctive shawl collars and made with bulky yarns and in geometric and bird/animal motifs traditionally done by the Canadian Cowichan First Nations people.
pattern_attributes.name: Cowichan (Salish)

pattern_attributes.description: regional knitting style from Denmark - textured patterning worked in knits and purls.
pattern_attributes.name: Danish

pattern_attributes.description: regional style of stranded colorwork or detailed, textured lace from Estonia.
pattern_attributes.name: Estonian

pattern_attributes.description: stranded colorwork specific to the Fair Isle and Shetland regions of Scotland using no more than two colors per row, limited color runs, and featuring distictive color banding.
pattern_attributes.name: Fair Isle

pattern_attributes.description: created with traditional techniques from the Faroe Islands, most often lace shawls with special shaping in the shoulders and a back gusset.
pattern_attributes.name: Faroese

pattern_attributes.description: traditional colorwork and lace designs created with techniques and motifs originating in Finland.
pattern_attributes.name: Finnish / Suomi

pattern_attributes.description: traditional knitting, often of seamans' sweaters, developed on the Channel Island of Guernsey. Sweaters often feature a raised shoulder seam, underam gussets and a split at the hem.
pattern_attributes.name: Guernsey / Gansey

pattern_attributes.description: stranded colorwork or lace patterns (often circular-yoke Lopi sweaters or lace shawls which can be multi-colored) created with traditional Icelandic techniques and motifs.
pattern_attributes.name: Icelandic

pattern_attributes.description: knitting or crochet created with techniques traditionally from Ireland. Often includes richly cabled garments (knitting) or floral/lace motifs (crochet).
pattern_attributes.name: Irish

pattern_attributes.description: techniques derived from the various regions of the Baltic state of Latvia, often used in mittens
pattern_attributes.name: Latvian

pattern_attributes.description: a variety of stranded colorwork, often two colors but sometimes three or more in a single row
pattern_attributes.name: Norwegian

pattern_attributes.description: very fine geometric lace originating in Orenburg, Russia
pattern_attributes.name: Orenburg

pattern_attributes.description: created with techniques from the indigenous S\u00e1mi people of Scandinavia and European Russia
pattern_attributes.name: Sami

pattern_attributes.description: very fine, traditional geometric lace or Fair Isle colorwork originating in the Shetland Islands.
pattern_attributes.name: Shetland

pattern_attributes.description: distinct styles of garment shaping and patterning originating in Sweden, including Bohus styes and Tvåändsstickning, or twined knitting.
pattern_attributes.name: Swedish

pattern_attributes.description: created with techniques traditionally from Turkey, often a form of colorwork featuring diagonal lines & geometric patterns
pattern_attributes.name: Turkish

pattern_attributes.description: an object that has height, width and depth
pattern_attributes.name: 3 dimensional

pattern_attributes.description: a shape where all the edges are the same distance from a central point
pattern_attributes.name: circle

pattern_attributes.description: the shape produced when a circle has a segment of another circle removed from its edge
pattern_attributes.name: crescent

pattern_attributes.description: three dimensional figure made of six squares
pattern_attributes.name: cube

pattern_attributes.description: half of a circle as divided by diameter
pattern_attributes.name: half-circle

pattern_attributes.description: six-sided shape
pattern_attributes.name: hexagon

pattern_attributes.description: eight-sided shape
pattern_attributes.name: octagon

pattern_attributes.description: egg shaped
pattern_attributes.name: oval

pattern_attributes.description: five-sided shape
pattern_attributes.name: pentagon

pattern_attributes.description: three dimensional figure made of four triangles
pattern_attributes.name: pyramid

pattern_attributes.description: four-sided with opposite sides of equal length, adjacent sides are at 90 degree  angles to each other
pattern_attributes.name: rectangle

pattern_attributes.description: three dimensional figure all points of which are equidistant from a fixed point
pattern_attributes.name: sphere

pattern_attributes.description: four-sided with all sides of equal length, adjacent sides are at 90 degree angles to  each other
pattern_attributes.name: square

pattern_attributes.description: shaped like a star
pattern_attributes.name: star

pattern_attributes.description: three-sided shape
pattern_attributes.name: triangle

pattern_attributes.description: a heel added to the sock after the rest of the sock is created
pattern_attributes.name: afterthought heel

pattern_attributes.description: a square flap pulled together under the heel by a series of short rows.
pattern_attributes.name: Dutch heel

pattern_attributes.description: heel created by working a flap flat and then turning the heel
pattern_attributes.name: heel flap

pattern_attributes.description: A heel worked flat using short-rows to taper to the tip
pattern_attributes.name: short row heel

pattern_attributes.description: a toe worked flat using short-rows to taper to the tip
pattern_attributes.name: short row toe

pattern_attributes.description: a toe resulting in a star-like wavy "X" when complete.
pattern_attributes.name: star

pattern_attributes.description: a toe with more stitches between the decreases, making a wider side section
pattern_attributes.name: wide

pattern_attributes.description: sock leg is worked straight, with no increases/decreases
pattern_attributes.name: no shaping

pattern_attributes.description: worked flat and then seamed
pattern_attributes.name: seamed sock

pattern_attributes.description: increased width towards the heel to add an arch to the foot of a sock
pattern_attributes.name: shaped arches

pattern_attributes.description: worked from the middle to each end
pattern_attributes.name: starting in middle

pattern_attributes.description: A method of making socks that uses the toe as a starting point
pattern_attributes.name: toe up

pattern_attributes.description: a method of making socks that uses the top of the sock cuff as a starting point
pattern_attributes.name: top/cuff down

pattern_attributes.description: instructions given for creating both socks simultaneously
pattern_attributes.name: two at a time
